alert.note: Alert for Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 8:26PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm with very heavy rainfall will impact portions of southwestern Essex County through 930 PM EDT... At 823 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm with very heavy rainfall near Newcomb, moving southeast at 15 mph. This storm has produced 1.42 inches of rainfall in 1 hour at the New York State Mesonet site in Newcomb. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor washouts of dirt roads across the higher terrain is possible, along with ponding of water in low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Minerva, Newcomb, Vanderwhacker Mountain, and Tahawus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
